intro: Gnaphalium pallidum, commonly known as the pale leaf cottonweed, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Its leaves are usually gray-green and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are small and yellowish-white. Gnaphalium pallidum is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in arid conditions.
